targets.expr:
clamp_min(clamp_max(
          max(
            max_over_time(pgbouncer_pools_server_active_connections{type="pgbouncer", environment="$environment", user="gitlab", database!="pgbouncer"}[$__interval]) /
            (
              (
                pgbouncer_pools_server_idle_connections{type="pgbouncer", environment="$environment", user="gitlab", database!="pgbouncer"} +
                pgbouncer_pools_server_active_connections{type="pgbouncer", environment="$environment", user="gitlab", database!="pgbouncer"} +
                pgbouncer_pools_server_testing_connections{type="pgbouncer", environment="$environment", user="gitlab", database!="pgbouncer"} +
                pgbouncer_pools_server_used_connections{type="pgbouncer", environment="$environment", user="gitlab", database!="pgbouncer"} +
                pgbouncer_pools_server_login_connections{type="pgbouncer", environment="$environment", user="gitlab", database!="pgbouncer"}
              )
              > 0
            )
          ) by (database)
      ,1),0)

panels.title: Server Connection Pool Saturation per Pool
Active Backend Server Connections per Database
Active Backend Server Connections per User

panels.description: pgbouncer is single-threaded. This graph shows maximum utilization across all cores on each host. Lower is better.
panels.title: Max Single Core Saturation per Node
Maximum Connection Waiting Time per Pool

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.
panels.title: Latency: Apdex

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions within a minute period. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better
panels.title: Error Ratios

panels.description: Availability measures the ratio of component processes in the service that are currently healthy and able to handle requests. The closer to 100% the better.
panels.title: Service Availability

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

targets.expr:
avg(
          clamp_min(
            gitlab_service_ops:rate:prediction{environment="$environment", type="redis", stage="main"} -
            gitlab_service_ops:rate:stddev_over_time_1w{environment="$environment", type="redis", stage="main"},
            0
          )
        )

avg(
          clamp_min(
            gitlab_service_ops:rate:prediction{environment="$environment", type="redis", stage=""} -
            gitlab_service_ops:rate:stddev_over_time_1w{environment="$environment", type="redis", stage=""},
            0
          )
        )

panels.title: RPS - Service Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of the most saturated component of the service. Lower is better.
panels.title: Saturation

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.
panels.title: Component Latency: Apdex

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better
panels.title: Component Error Rates - modified scale: (1 + n) log10

panels.description: Availability measures the ratio of component processes in the service that are currently healthy and able to handle requests. The closer to 100% the better.
panels.title: Component Availability

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: Component RPS - Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.
panels.title: Saturation

panels.description: The amount of non-idle time consumed by nodes for this service
panels.title: Node CPU

panels.description: Network utilization for nodes for this service
panels.title: Node Network Utilization
